alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; James City; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 2:25PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Gloucester, northwestern York, southeastern New Kent and northwestern James City Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 225 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Barhamsville, or near Toano, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Williamsburg, Norge, Toano, Barhamsville, Holly Forks, York River State Park, Croaker, Barlows Corner, Lanexa, Centerville, Ewell, Christensons Corner, Warren Mill, Skimino, Diascund, Lightfoot, Kings Corner and Oaktree. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
